A careless admin used two Blum integers as RSA primes. Can you recover the message from the intercepted cipher? Ciphertext: 9767708342698820581621415962201924106794602540053791715488108303386107383337284744637794007716991455843284244077208223945618259558410876241280668493402718

The flag format is flag{...}
n=9884259526123887157240913957160127164006228830887378869880016690116353755401126820408140260788787117684732944114375302737309172898205948516774713646709381, e=5985827241820675695709625611723597468047778877156297263872793693893363822608365395433138429772044384034266883497358987623590425382413037288722755715552443
The lower 104 bits of p are: 18281732057786801525578320605660134635


---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{hxnj8bga}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 9767708342698820581621415962201924106794602540053791715488108303386107383337284744637794007716991455843284244077208223945618259558410876241280668493402718
vulnerability: blum integers
hint: Blum integers are products of primes congruent to 3 modulo 4. These integers have unique properties in cryptography.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=9884259526123887157240913957160127164006228830887378869880016690116353755401126820408140260788787117684732944114375302737309172898205948516774713646709381, e=5985827241820675695709625611723597468047778877156297263872793693893363822608365395433138429772044384034266883497358987623590425382413037288722755715552443
The lower 104 bits of p are: 18281732057786801525578320605660134635

extra_info: p=100080344899185150955071212965749094529179514479870172603613865845796556848363, q=98763244032389063962096466670785198293254412666526689672089761461956766468687, Ï†(n)=9884259526123887157240913957160127164006228830887378869880016690116353755400927976819208686573869950005096409821552868810162776035930244889466960323392332
